private_information: I can only interact with vowel blocks A E I
I can only move the top block of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, and J is on the table

private_information: I can only interact with consonant blocks B C D F G H J
I can only move the top block of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, and J is on the table

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their PDDL responses
I must keep the agents actions distinct and produce a combined PDDL for FastDownward
orchestrator.goal: Produce a coordinated PDDL domain and problem that achieves the target stacking A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J with J on the table

public_information: There are ten uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J

Initial configuration: D is on the table, J is on the table, I is on the table, C is on top of J, E is on top of C, H is on top of E, F is on top of D, G is on top of F, A is on top of H, B is on top of G
Only the top block of any stack can be moved
Agents can move only one block at a time
One agent can only move vowel blocks A E I and the other can only move consonant blocks B C D F G H J
The goal configuration is a single stack from top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J and J should be on the table
PDDL files should target the FastDownward PDDL solver

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems and FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: There are ten uniquely labeled blocks A B C D E F G H I J. Initial configuration: D is on the table, J is on the table, I is on the table, C is on top of J, E is on top of C, H is on top of E, F is on top of D, G is on top of F, A is on top of H, B is on top of G. Only the top block of any stack can be moved. Agents can move only one block at a time. One agent can only move vowel blocks A E I. The goal configuration is a single stack from top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J and J should be on the table. You have the following private information: I can only interact with vowel blocks A E I. I can only move the top block of a stack. I can move only one block at a time. This is your goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, and J is on the table. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode only the information you have and that are compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems and FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: There are ten uniquely labeled blocks A B C D E F G H I J. Initial configuration: D is on the table, J is on the table, I is on the table, C is on top of J, E is on top of C, H is on top of E, F is on top of D, G is on top of F, A is on top of H, B is on top of G. Only the top block of any stack can be moved. Agents can move only one block at a time. One agent can only move consonant blocks B C D F G H J. The goal configuration is a single stack from top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J and J should be on the table. You have the following private information: I can only interact with consonant blocks B C D F G H J. I can only move the top block of a stack. I can move only one block at a time. This is your goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, and J is on the table. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode only the information you have and that are compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems and FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, you keep their actions distinct and integrate their PDDL fragments into a coherent multi-agent PDDL model.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents in an environment that are planning to solve a blocks rearrangement task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: Produce a coordinated PDDL domain and problem that achieves the target stacking A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J with J on the table. Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem but may require integration of additional information from the other PDDL to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may appear in different forms for example two PDDL problems may refer to the same object with different names. Here is the information the first agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_vowel_agent}. Here is the information the second agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_consonant_agent}. You need to integrate the PDDL responses of the two agents to solve the task. It is important that you keep the actions of the two agents distinct and that the resulting domain and problem target the FastDownward solver. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that coordinate the agents. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
